newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler remake to include job cuts-sources.
newsitem.headline: Daimler remake to include job cuts-sources.

text.p: A sweeping restructuring at Daimler-Benz AG could result in the elimination of several hundred jobs, company sources said on Friday.

According to sources, about half of the 3,000 employees who work at Daimler's central management headquarters locations could be affected by the overhaul. Of that number several hundred may have to leave the company.
Daimler chairman Juergen Schrempp met around 1,400 executives here on Friday to explain the company's reorganisation plans which were approved by Daimler's supervisory board on Thursday.
He did not give a specific figure regarding job cuts.

Under the scheme, Mercedes-Benz AG will be legally wound down and merged into the group's management structure. The other two major units, Daimler-Benz Aerospace AG (DASA) and Debis AG, will remain fully independent units.
Daimler said it made the move to speed decision making and cut costs.
Daimler also plans to grow in all of its areas of activity and that sales would increase across the board over the next 10 years, the group said in its current in-house publication for employees.
Schrempp said that the new group stucture was the basis for this growth and called for the support of Daimler employees to make the restructuring a success.
"We are looking for your support to ensure that what realise plans we have only seen on paper so far," Schrempp said in the newsletter.
